TITLE: Tension in the Vatican revealed by top aide following death of Benedict XVI
SUMMARY: Hours after the funeral for Pope Benedict XVI, an Italian publisher released copies of a tell-all book that revealed years of tension in the Vatican.

SUMMARY: Former Commander of the British Forces in Afghanistan Richard Kemp raised concerns that Prince Harry's comments could fuel anger amongst extremist groups in the Middle East.

SUMMARY: The U.S. committed the single largest defensive aid package to Ukraine yet after pledging $3 million in latest drawdown as it looks to change the 'dynamic on the battlefield.'

SUMMARY: A British newspaper reported teachers in the United Kingdom are struggling with how to handle the rise in students who are "brainwashed" by the misogynistic teachings of Andrew Tate.

SUMMARY: Police departments in the UK have spent thousands on merchandise supporting the gay community, prompting critics to call on departments to stop 'wasting money on woke nonsense.'

SUMMARY: Supporters of former Brazilian President Bolsonaro on Sunday stormed past security and raided the Planalto Palace in Brasilia a week after the inauguration of Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.

SUMMARY: Jens Stoltenberg, NATO's secretary-general, believes it's time for Sweden to join NATO. Turkey has been holding up the process of allowing Sweden to join.

SUMMARY: A ship in the Suez Canal that was grounded was refloated on Monday. The vessel that was grounded was heading to China but broke down near the city of Qantara.

SUMMARY: Five journalists in Belarus are on trial. The journalists are facing charges of "hurting national security," dodging taxes, and "inciting hatred."

SUMMARY: An Alabama woman who fled home to join ISIS in 2014 is hoping to return to the U.S., saying she regrets he actions and vowing to be an advocate against extremism.

SUMMARY: New plans to tighten hunting regulations in France were instituted by the country's government. An outright ban that activists were hoping for was not instituted.

SUMMARY: Chinese citizens are eager to renew their passports after the country dropped the COVID-19 border controls that had prevented travel for three years during the pandemic.

SUMMARY: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro is hospitalized in Florida with abdominal discomfort linked to a prior stabbing, according to his wife.

SUMMARY: Mexican National Guard officials successfully rescued Wednesday three young siblings that were left to fend for themselves near the US-Mexico border.

TITLE: UK commits to sending Ukraine Challenger 2 tanks, going further than Biden admin.
SUMMARY: The United Kingdom pledged to send Ukraine Challenger 2 tanks Saturday as its forces engage in a brutal warfare on the eastern front.

TITLE: Kyiv hit with Russian missiles in first attack in weeks
SUMMARY: Kyiv was hit Saturday with missile strikes in the first attack since the New Year kicked off two weeks ago, though no causalities have been reported.

TITLE: China reports 60,000 coronavirus-related deaths from December after concerns of underreporting
SUMMARY: Beijing finally reported nearly 60,000 coronavirus deaths since Dec. 8 and after reporting nearly none since a surge hit in October and after it lifted lockdown restrictions.
